left.heading: When U.S. care is out of reach, patients are forced into hard choices.
body: In the U.S., many people postpone necessary procedures because of high costs, long wait times, or confusing insurance rules.
Others look abroad on their own—scrolling through ads and marketplaces with no way to verify safety, quality, or true costs.
bullets: Unpredictable bills and surprise add-on fees.
Unclear hospital credentials and infection control standards.
Language barriers and fragmented follow-up care.

right.heading: MyHealth Haven turns medical travel into a guided, transparent path.
body: We bridge the U.S. and Mexican healthcare systems, combining American standards with Mexico’s clinical excellence and affordability.
Every patient works with a dedicated Health Navigator™ who coordinates options, pricing, logistics, and post-procedure support.
pillarsSummary: Safety & Standards aligned with U.S. expectations.
Continuity of Care with your U.S. providers.

content.heading: Frequently asked questions
content.subheading: If you are considering care in Mexico, you should have clear, honest answers.

items.question: Is medical care in Mexico safe?
items.answer: Safety is our first filter. We partner only with hospitals and clinicians that meet defined standards for credentialing, infection control, and transparency. Your Health Navigator™ will walk you through how each partner is evaluated and what those standards mean in practice.

items.question: How do I know what my procedure will really cost?
items.answer: Before you travel, you receive an all-inclusive estimate that covers hospital, surgeon, anesthesia, standard imaging, and typical hospital stay. We explain what is—and is not—included, and outline scenarios that could change the total so you are not surprised.

items.question: Can I talk to my U.S. doctor about this?
items.answer: Yes, and we encourage it. With your permission, we can share relevant information with your U.S. clinician and help coordinate pre-operative testing and post-operative follow-up.

items.question: What if complications occur?
items.answer: Your Navigator will explain how the hospital handles complications, how additional costs are managed, and how follow-up care works if you need it. We focus on centers with clear, written protocols for these situations.

items.question: Do I have to decide right away?
items.answer: No. Many patients start with an informational call to understand options. There is no obligation to travel or book a procedure after speaking with a Health Navigator™.
